Social Media & Internet Culture.name: Decoding the Digital Dawn
Social Media & Internet Culture.description: Journey back to the early days of the internet and test your knowledge of foundational tech terms and pioneers. This quiz explores the building blocks of the digital world we know today. From acronyms to elements, see how much you remember about the internet's origins.

questions.text: In computer terminology, what does the acronym 'FTP' stand for?
questions.hint: This protocol is used to move files between computers over the internet.

questions.text: In computer terminology, what does the acronym 'ISP' stand for?
questions.hint: This service connects you to the internet, like Comcast or Verizon.

questions.text: Ada Lovelace is credited with being the first person to have made what?
questions.hint: Her work with Charles Babbage involved early concepts of computing.

questions.text: Modern computer microchips are primarily composed of what element?
questions.hint: This element is abundant in sand and central to the semiconductor industry.

questions.text: What does the 'ROM' in CD-ROM stand for?
questions.hint: This term describes a type of computer memory that cannot be altered.

Social Media & Internet Culture.name: The Amazonian Roots
Social Media & Internet Culture.description: Discover the surprising beginnings of some of the internet's biggest names. This quiz delves into the early days of companies like Amazon and Apple, revealing their humble origins and unexpected first steps. How well do you know the history of online retail and personal computing?

questions.text: What was the original name of the Apple Macintosh XL computer?
questions.hint: This name was a nod to Steve Jobs’ daughter, used for an earlier Apple model.

questions.text: When it first appeared on the Internet, amazon.com sold only what?
questions.hint: The company started as an online bookstore before expanding to everything.

questions.text: What internet company goes by the acronym AOL?
questions.hint: This company was a pioneer in dial-up internet services in the 1990s.

Social Media & Internet Culture.name: Silicon & Code
Social Media & Internet Culture.description: Explore the intersection of hardware and software with this quiz. It covers foundational concepts in computer science, from the materials that make up microchips to the groundbreaking work of early programmers. Are you fluent in the language of technology?

questions.text: Modern computer microchips are primarily composed of what element?
questions.hint: This element is abundant in sand and central to the semiconductor industry.

questions.text: What does the 'ROM' in CD-ROM stand for?

questions.text: Ada Lovelace is credited with being the first person to have made what?
questions.hint: Her work with Charles Babbage involved early concepts of computing.

Social Media & Internet Culture.name: The Web's First Chapter
Social Media & Internet Culture.description: Test your knowledge of the early internet landscape with this comprehensive quiz. From online retailers to foundational acronyms, this quiz covers a wide range of topics related to the web's formative years. Can you navigate the digital past?

questions.text: When it first appeared on the Internet, amazon.com sold only what?
questions.hint: The company started as an online bookstore before expanding to everything.

Social Media & Internet Culture.name: Macintosh Memories
Social Media & Internet Culture.description: Relive the era of the Macintosh with this quiz focused on Apple's iconic computer line. From its original name to the technology within, this quiz explores the history and innovation behind a revolutionary product. How much do you know about the machine that changed computing?

questions.text: What was the original name of the Apple Macintosh XL computer?

Social Media & Internet Culture.name: Pioneers of the Pixel
Social Media & Internet Culture.description: Celebrate the visionaries who shaped the digital world with this quiz. From Ada Lovelace's groundbreaking work to the early days of online retail, this quiz explores the individuals and innovations that paved the way for the internet we know today. Are you ready to meet the architects of the online age?
